February 1969

University President Andrew W. Cordier meets with members of

Morningside United. Community groups attack Cordier’s plans

as Columbia considers purchasing more land in Rockland.

Small wonder indeed that the

Rockland residents recoil at the

mention of the name of Columbia.

- Columbia Daily Spectator

March 1969

Columbia abandons plans for the Morningside

gymnasium as well as Rockland expansion.

1989

Restoration of the park begins. Plans to turn the foundational

crater into an ornamental pond and waterfall are announced.
